<ce:section-title>Syntheses of the ligands and the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Synthesis of 3,5-pmb and 3,4-pmb</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">3,5-Dihydroxybenzoic acid (15.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), ethanol (53<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) and sulfuric acid (4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) were mixed and refluxed for 6–7<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. The excess ethanol was removed under vacuum, and then the reaction mixture was extracted with ethylacetate. The extracted solution was washed once with water, and then with NaHCO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> aqueous solution<ce:inf loc="post">.</ce:inf> After drying with Na<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>, the solvent was evaporated. To 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol (3.64<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) of the product, 40<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol (6.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) of 4-pycolyl chloride hydrochloride and 120<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol (4.8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) of NaOH and 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml DMF were added. The mixture was heated at 70<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, and then the product was washed with ethanol and filtered. The solid product was transferred to a 100<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml round bottom flask, 50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml of 5% NaOH solution was added and the resulting solution was refluxed at 70<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, then the mixture was transferred into a 400<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml beaker. After adding 50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml of distilled and concentrated HCl drop by drop, a light brown precipitate was obtained at about pH 6, which was washed with ethanol and filtered. Yield: 72%. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (336.11): C, 67.85; H, 4.79; N, 8.33%. Found: C, 67.91; H, 4.98; N, 8.26%. M.p. for the crude product is 128<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C.</ce:para><ce:para view="all">The synthetical method of 3,4-pmb was similar to the synthesis of 3,5-pmb, except that 3,4-dihydroxybenzoic acid was used instead of 3,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid. Yield: 60%. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (336.11): C, 67.85; H, 4.79; N, 8.33. Found: C, 67.91; H, 4.98; N, 8.26%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Ni(3,4-pmb)(bdc)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was prepared from a mixture of NiCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.066<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), 3,4-pmb (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.073<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), bdc (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.033<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) and NaOH (0.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.024<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) in 8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml distilled water. This mixture was heated in a sealed Teflon lined steel autoclave at 150<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for three days. After the mixture was slowly cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C/h, green crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were obtained (yield: 58% based on Ni). <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">23</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">15</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>Ni (538.08): C, 51.34; H, 2.81; N, 5.21. Found: C, 50.69; H, 2.79; N, 5.20%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Co(3,5-pmb)(bdc)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">A mixture of Co(OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.075<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), 3,5-pmb (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.073<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), bdc (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.033<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) and NaOH (0.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol,0.024<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) was dissolved in 8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml distilled water. The mixture was heated in sealed Teflon lined steel autoclave at 150<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for three days. After cooling to room temperature at a rate of 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C/h, crystals of the product were obtained (yield: 52% based on Co). <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">23</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">17</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>Co (476.32): C, 58.00; H, 3.60; N, 5.88. Found: C, 57.96; H, 3.20; N, 5.79%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Cd(3,5-pmb)(bdc)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The procedure was similar to the synthesis of complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> except that Cd(OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 0.08<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) was used instead of Co(OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O. Yield: 64% based on Cd. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">23</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">17</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>Cd (529.79): C, 54.91; H, 3.41; N, 5.57. Found: C, 54.85; H, 3.32; N, 5.55%.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Syntheses of the ligands and the complexes

Synthesis of 3,5-pmb and 3,4-pmb

3,5-Dihydroxybenzoic acid (15.4g), ethanol (53ml) and sulfuric acid (4ml) were mixed and refluxed for 6-7h. The excess ethanol was removed under vacuum, and then the reaction mixture was extracted with ethylacetate. The extracted solution was washed once with water, and then with NaHCO3 aqueous solution. After drying with Na2SO4, the solvent was evaporated. To 20mmol (3.64g) of the product, 40mmol (6.5g) of 4-pycolyl chloride hydrochloride and 120mmol (4.8g) of NaOH and 10ml DMF were added. The mixture was heated at 70°C for 10h, and then the product was washed with ethanol and filtered. The solid product was transferred to a 100ml round bottom flask, 50ml of 5% NaOH solution was added and the resulting solution was refluxed at 70°C for 5h, then the mixture was transferred into a 400ml beaker. After adding 50ml of distilled and concentrated HCl drop by drop, a light brown precipitate was obtained at about pH 6, which was washed with ethanol and filtered. Yield: 72%. Anal. Calc. for C19H16N2O4 (336.11): C, 67.85; H, 4.79; N, 8.33%. Found: C, 67.91; H, 4.98; N, 8.26%. M.p. for the crude product is 128°C.

The synthetical method of 3,4-pmb was similar to the synthesis of 3,5-pmb, except that 3,4-dihydroxybenzoic acid was used instead of 3,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid. Yield: 60%. Anal. Calc. for C19H16N2O4 (336.11): C, 67.85; H, 4.79; N, 8.33. Found: C, 67.91; H, 4.98; N, 8.26%.

[Ni(3,4-pmb)(bdc)0.5] (1)

Compound 1 was prepared from a mixture of NiCl2 ⋅6H2O (0.3mmol, 0.066g), 3,4-pmb (0.2mmol, 0.073g), bdc (0.2mmol, 0.033g) and NaOH (0.6mmol, 0.024g) in 8ml distilled water. This mixture was heated in a sealed Teflon lined steel autoclave at 150°C for three days. After the mixture was slowly cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10°C/h, green crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: 58% based on Ni). Anal. Calc. for C23H15N2O10Ni (538.08): C, 51.34; H, 2.81; N, 5.21. Found: C, 50.69; H, 2.79; N, 5.20%.

[Co(3,5-pmb)(bdc)0.5] (2)

A mixture of Co(OAc)2 ⋅2H2O (0.3mmol, 0.075g), 3,5-pmb (0.2mmol, 0.073g), bdc (0.2mmol, 0.033g) and NaOH (0.6mmol,0.024g) was dissolved in 8ml distilled water. The mixture was heated in sealed Teflon lined steel autoclave at 150°C for three days. After cooling to room temperature at a rate of 10°C/h, crystals of the product were obtained (yield: 52% based on Co). Anal. Calc. for C23H17N2O6Co (476.32): C, 58.00; H, 3.60; N, 5.88. Found: C, 57.96; H, 3.20; N, 5.79%.

[Cd(3,5-pmb)(bdc)0.5] (3)

The procedure was similar to the synthesis of complex 2 except that Cd(OAc)2 ⋅2H2O (0.3mmol, 0.08g) was used instead of Co(OAc)2 ⋅2H2O. Yield: 64% based on Cd. Anal. Calc. for C23H17N2O6Cd (529.79): C, 54.91; H, 3.41; N, 5.57. Found: C, 54.85; H, 3.32; N, 5.55%.
